alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Clark; Fayette; Greene; Madison (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:17PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN CHAMPAIGN, NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE, CLARK, NORTHERN GREENE AND WESTERN MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 517 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near New Carlisle, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Kettering, Beavercreek, Fairborn, Xenia, London, New Carlisle, Yellow Springs, Wright-Patterson Afb, Northridge, Cedarville, Enon, South Charleston, Choctaw Lake, Wilberforce, Harmony, Lisbon, Brighton, North Hampton and Lafayette. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 42 and 79. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 76 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for west central Ohio. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
